meanings.definition: Straps attached to the back or side of a boot for pulling it on.
meanings.sent1: He tugged on the bootstraps to slide his foot into the boot.
meanings.sent2: The cowboy pulled on his bootstraps before heading out to the ranch.
meanings.sent3: In the story, the magical bootstraps helped the character fly like a superhero.
meanings.sent4: She held onto her bootstraps tightly, as if they were the only thing keeping her grounded.
meanings.sent5: The old man cherished his worn bootstraps, a reminder of his adventurous past.

meanings.definition: To improve one's situation or solve one's own problems without outside help.
meanings.sent1: She knew she had to pull herself up by her bootstraps and find a job.
meanings.sent2: When faced with adversity, he always tried to bootstrap his way out of it.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that he tried to bootstrap his way through a cooking class but ended up burning everything.
meanings.sent4: In the face of challenges, she decided to grab life by the bootstraps and make a change.
meanings.sent5: He inspired others by showing how to bootstrap their way to success through hard work.
